title: Part A and Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The primary goals of this question were to assess a studentâ€™s ability to (1) describe a procedure for identifying a potential outlier, (2) apply the outlier identification procedure to data presented in a stemplot and (3) describe the distribution of data presented in a stemplot.

Scoring

Parts (a) and (b) are each scored as essentially correct (E), partially correct (P), or incorrect (I).
descriptions: One part partially correct and one part incorrect
One part essentially correct and one part incorrect OR two parts partially correct
One part essentially correct and one part partially correct
